data.body: Which of the following statements concerning erection is INCORRECT?

answerChoices.body: Erection is achieved by the engorgement of the corpora cavernosa sinusoids with blood.
Nitric oxide (NO) plays a crucial role in this process by stimulating the enzyme guanylate cyclase.
cGMP relaxes the smooth muscle of the deep arteries and cavernous spaces of the corpora cavernosa.
Erection is controlled by the sympathetic division of the autonomic nervous system.

explanation.body:
Erection is controlled by the parasympathetic division of the autonomic nervous system, not the sympathetic. Here's how the process of erection works:

\underline{\textbf{We need to relax smooth muscle → fill with blood}}
In order to have an erection, the corpora cavernosa sinusoids in the penis must fill with blood. 

To do this, the parasympathetic nervous system stimulates relaxation of cavernosal smooth muscle cells to allow more blood in. 

\underline{\textbf{How do we relax the actually smooth muscle? (NO-cGMP pathway)}}
Nitric oxide (NO) is released from nerve endings and endothelial cells. The NO enters the cell and activates the enzyme guanylate cyclase, which produces cyclic guanosine monophosphate (cGMP). 

The cGMP simulates a protein kinase that decreases intracellular calcium concentration. This all results in smooth muscle relaxation.
